title: Water Scarcity - explained in a nutshell

tasks.task: Understand the global water crisis and its agricultural impacts
subtasks: Recognize Earth's water composition (70% water, 97% salty, 2% frozen, 1% drinkable)
Identify challenges in water distribution and access (700 million without clean water)
Analyze agricultural water use (groundwater, marshlands, problematic in dry climates)
Assess contributions of climate change and pollution to water scarcity
Project future water demand and potential conflicts (40% higher by 2025)
Advocate for behavioral, technological, and policy changes in water management
Emphasize the urgency of water conservation and equitable resource allocation

tasks.task: Examine the role of technology in water security
subtasks: Consider blockchain technology for water system protection and transparency
Explore historical data tracking through blockchain in water management
Assess potential for decentralized water resource systems using blockchain
Consider the scalability and adoption challenges of new water infrastructure technologies
Weigh the importance of international cooperation in addressing water scarcity issues

tasks.task: The task list presents two main MAINTASKs related to the video transcript on water scarcity: understanding the global water crisis and its agricultural impacts (Task 1) and examining the role of technology in water security (Task 2). Under Task 1, subtasks include recognizing Earth's water composition, challenges in distribution, agricultural usage, and the role of climate change. Subtasks for Task 2 focus on blockchain technology for water systems, historical data tracking, and the need for international cooperation. These tasks collectively outline the key aspects discussed in the transcript regarding water scarcity and potential solutions.
